$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 534-17-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7681-65-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General Procedure for C-N Coupling Reactions of β -Bromostyrene and
Heterocycle Copper(I) iodide (0.1 equiv) and Cs2CO3 (2.0 equiv) were
added to a screw-capped test tube. The tube was then evacuated and
backfilled with argon (3 cycles). N,N Dimethylformamide (2 mL),
nitrogen-containing heterocycles (1.2 equiv; if liquid) and vinyl halide
(1.0 equiv; if liquid) were added by syringe at r.t. The tube was again
evacuated and backfilled with argon (3 cycles). The mixture was heated to
120 °C and stirred for 36-50 h. After cooling to r.t., the mixture was
diluted with H2O, and the combined aqueous phases were extracted three
times with EtOAc. The organic layers were combined, dried over Na2SO4,
and concentrated to yield the crude product, which was further purified
by silica gel chromatography, using PE and EtOAc as eluents to provide
the desired product. Compound 1, yield 95%. Mp 184-185 °C. 1H NMR
(DMSOd6): δ = 8.02 (s, 1 H, 2-H in imidazole), 7.85 (d, J = 14.4 Hz, 1 H,
CH=CHPh), 7.71 (s, 1 H, ArH), 7.26-7.51 (m, 5 H, ArH), 7.05 (s, 1 H,
ArH), 7.01-7.05 (m, 2 H, CH=CHPh and ArH). 13C NMR (CDCl3): δ = 136.1,
134.8, 130.8, 129.4, 128.5, 126.6, 123.1, 119.3, 116.7. HRMS: m/z calcd
for C11H10N2 [M+ + H]: 170.0844; found: 170.0843
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM stereoselective, Ullmann-type coupling, optimized on addition of catalyst
and ligand, ligand type, base, and reaction temperature, optimization
study, scalable
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM CuI-catalyzed cross-coupling reaction of (E)-vinyl bromides with
nitrogen-containing heterocycles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Mao, Jincheng; Hua, Qiongqiong; Guo, Jun; Shi, Daqing; Ji, Shunjun
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2008), (13), 2011-2016

$DATUM 67-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: In an oven dried 100 mL RB flask, Cu-PAR (0.05
g, 0.0129 mmol), aryl halide (1 mmol), N-H heterocycles (1.2 mmol), K2CO3
(2 mmol), and 10 mL DMSO were stirred under nitrogen atmosphere, at 100
°C. The reaction mixtures were collected at different time interval and
identified by GCMS and quantified by GC analysis. After the completion of
the reaction, the catalyst was filtered off and washed with water
followed by acetone and dried in oven. The filtrate was extracted with
ethyl acetate (3 × 20 mL) and the combined organic layers were dried with
anhydrous Na2SO4 by vacuum. The filtrate was con- centrated by vacuum and
the resulting residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
to provide the desired product. 1-Phenyl-1H-imidazole (A), Time (h): 14,
Yield (%): 95. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.85 (s, 1H), 7.53-7.44 (m, 2H),
7.42-7.35 (m, 3H), 7.28 (bs, 1H), 7.21 (bs, 1H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3)
δ 136.1, 134.5, 130.1, 129.3, 127.4, 121.3, 118.2.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM solid-supported catalyst, catalyst prepared and used, chloromethylated
polystyrene-supported copper(II) 4-(2-pyridylazo)resorcinol complex
catalyst used, reused catalyst gave moderately lower yield, alternative
reaction conditions shown, alternative bases
(Na2CO3,Cs2CO3,K3PO4,Et3N,KOH) or solvents (toluene,water,DMF,ACN,MeOH)
gave lower yield, alternative preparation shown, optimized on
base,solvent,temperature, optimization study

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Arylazoles 3 and 4; General Procedure A sealed
tube equipped with a Teflon valve was charged with a magnetic stir bar,
CuBr (7 mg, 0.05 mmol, 5 mol%), Cs2CO3 (650 mg, 2 mmol) and any remaining
solids (azoles 2 and/or aryl halides 1). The tube was evacuated and
backfilled with N2 (3×). Under a counter flow of N2, azole 2 (1.2 mmol,
if liquid), aryl halide 1 (1 mmol, if liquid), DMSO (1.0 mL), and L1 (18
mg, 0.10 mmol, 10 mol%) were added by syringe. The tube was evacuated and
again backfilled with N2 (3×) and sealed. The mixture was heated to the
indicated temperature for the required time period. After cooling to
r.t., the mixture was diluted with EtOAc (25 mL), passed through a
fritted glass filter to remove the inorganic salts and the filtrate was
washed by H2O, brine, then removed under vacuum. The residue was purified
by column chromatography (silica gel) and the product was dried under
high vacuum (at least 1 h). 1-Phenyl-1H-imidazole (3a)5e 1H NMR (300 MHz,
DMSO-d 6): δ = 8.28 (s, 1 H), 7.76 (t, 1 H), 7.67 (q, J = 5.8 Hz, 2 H),
7.53 (t, 2 H), 7.37 (t, 1 H), 7.14 (s, 1 H). MS: m/z = 144.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM alternative reaction conditions shown, optimized on catalyst
system,base,solvent, alternative catalysts (none,CuI,CuCl),catalyst
ligand (none,(2-pyridyl)acetone),bases (Na2CO3,K2CO3,NaOH,Et3N) or
solvents (MeCN,i-PrOH,DMF,water) gave lower yield, alternative
preparation shown, optimization study

$DATUM 7681-65-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure. An oven-dried 25 mL
round-bottomed flask with a magnetic stirring bar was charged with CuI
nanoparticles (1.25 mol %), K2CO3 (0.1662 g, 1.2 mmol),
nitrogencontaining heterocycle (1.2 mmol)/phenol (1.2 mmol), aryl
chloride (1.0 mmol), and DMF (1 mL) under air. The reaction mixture was
stirred for 30 min at room temperature and then transferred to a
preheated oil bath at 110 °C. At the end of the reaction, as judged by
TLC, the reaction mixture was then cooled to room temperature, diluted
with 2-3 mL of EtOAc, and centrifuged to remove the catalyst, and the
catalyst was further washed with 5-10 mL of EtOAc to make it free from
organic matter. The combined organic extracts were then concentrated
under reduced pressure, and the resulting residue was purified by column
chromatography on silica gel (60-120) using hexane/ethyl acetate (80:20)
eluent to provide the desired N-arylated/ O-arylated product. The
catalyst was oven-dried at 65 °C for 2 h and reused.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM CuI nanoparticles used as cat..
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM CuI Nanoparticles for C-N and C-O Cross Coupling of Heterocyclic Amines
and Phenols with Chlorobenzenes
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Sreedhar, B.; Arundhathi, R.; Reddy, P. Linga; Kantam, M. Lakshmi
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(20), 7951-7954

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 534-17-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 25322-68-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1317-39-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 92149-07-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-74-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General procedure for the N-arylation of imidazoles with aryl iodides. An
oven-dried screw-cap test tube was charged with Cu2O (0.025 mmol), L1c
(0.075 mmol), imidazole (1.2 mmol), aryl iodide (1.00 mmol, if solid),
poly(ethylene glycol) (200 mg), Cs2CO3 (1.4 mmol), and a magnetic stir
bar. The reaction vessel was fitted with a rubber septum. The vessel was
evacuated and back-filled with argon or nitrogen, and this sequence was
repeated an additional time. Aryl iodide (1.00 mmol, if liquid) and
solvent (0.5 mL) were then added successively. The reaction tube was
sealed, and stirred in a pre-heated oil bath for the designated time
period. The reaction mixture was cooled to room temperature, diluted with
dichloromethane (10 mL), and filtered through a plug of celite, eluting
with additional dichloromethane (50 mL). The filtrate was concentrated
and the resulting residue was purified by flash chromatography to provide
the desired product. 1-Phenyl-1H-imidazole (1a) The low catalyst loading
experiment was preformed using the general procedure with Cu2O (0.4 mg,
0.0025 mmol), L1c (1.8 mg, 0.0075 mmol), PEG (2.0 g), Cs2CO3 (4.50 g, 14
mmol), iodobenze (1.12 mL, 10 mmol), and imidazole (820 mg, 12 mmol), in
butyronitrile (2.0 mL) as solvent for 48 h at 110 °C. Chromatographic
purification (hexane / ethyl acetate 1 : 3) provided
1-phenyl-1H-imidazole (slightly yellow oil, 1.34 g, 93%). 1H NMR (300
MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.82 (s, 1H), 7.47-7.41 (m, 2H),7.36-7.29 (m, 3H), 7.25
(bs, 1H), 7.18 (bs, 1H).5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Copper-Catalyzed N-Arylation of Imidazoles and Benzimidazoles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Altman, Ryan A.; Koval, Erica D.; Buchwald, Stephen L.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2007), 72(16), 6190-6199

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME2 STEP1

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Coupling of Aryl Iodides with Amines at Room
Temperature; General Procedure An oven-dried Schlenk tube was charged
with CuI (20 mg, 10 mol%), Cs2CO3 (652 mg, 2 mmol), and 3-acetylcoumarin
(L5, 38 mg, 20 mol%). The tube was evacuated and backfilled with N2 (this
procedure was repeated 3 ×). Then aryl halide (1.0 mmol), amine (1.5
mmol), and DMF (0.5 mL) were added under N2. The tube was sealed and the
mixture was stirred at r.t. for 24 h. The resulting suspension was
filtered through a pad of silica gel with the help of CH2Cl2 (50 mL). The
filtrate was concentrated and the residue was purified by column
chromatography (silica gel, EtOAc-PE). The product. 1-Phenyl-1H-imidazole
(3o)18 . IR (KBr): 3112, 1602, 1510, 1305, 1260, 1057, 960, 903, 814,
757, 688, 655, 515 cm-1. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 7.86 (s, 1 H),
7.52-7.44 (m, 2 H), 7.42-7.33 (m, 3 H), 7.28 (s, 1 H), 7.21 (s, 1 H). 13C
NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 137.4, 135.6, 130.4, 129.9, 127.6, 121.6,
118.3. GC-MS (EI): m/z = 144.04 [M]+.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM 3-Acetylcoumarin as a practical ligand for copper-catalyzed C-N coupling
reactions at room temperature
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Tao, Chuan-Zhou; Liu, Wei-Wei; Sun, Ji-You; Cao, Zhi-Ling; Li, Hui;
Zhang, Ying-Fen
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2010), (8), 1280-1284

$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General Procedure. A flame-dried Schlenk test tube with a magnetic
stirring bar was charged with CuI (38.4 mg, 0.2 mmol), K3PO4 (0.422 g,
2.0 mmol), nitrogen-containing heterocycle (1.4 mmol), aryl halide (1.0
mmol), and DMF (1 mL) under N2 atmosphere. A rubber septum was replaced
with a glass stopper, and the system was then evacuated twice and back
filled with N2. After being stirred at 35-40 °C for 40 h, the reaction
mixture was diluted with 2-3 mL of ethyl acetate, filtered through a plug
of silica gel, and washed with 10-20 mL of ethyl acetate. The filtrate
was concentrated and the resulting residue was purified by column
chromatography on silica gel to provide the desired product.
1-Phenyl-1H-imidazole (3a)3-6 Following the general procedure, the crude
product was purified over a silica gel column using ethyl
acetate/petroleum ether (1/1) to give pale yellow oil (93% yield). 1H NMR
(400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 7.24 (s, 1H), 7.31 (s, 1H), 7.36-7.40 (m, 3H), 7.47
(t, J = 7.6 Hz, 2H), 7.89 (s, 1H) ppm. 13C NMR (150 MHz, CDCl3): δ 118.3,
121.5, 127.5, 129.9, 130.3, 135.7, 137.3 ppm. GC-MS (EI, m/z): 144 [M+].
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM yield depends on reaction conditions (base, cat, solvent and amt.of cat)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Highly Functional Group Tolerance in Copper-Catalyzed N-Arylation of
Nitrogen-Containing Heterocycles under Mild Conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Zhu, Liangbo; Li, Gaocan; Luo, Liang; Guo, Peng; Lan, Jingbo; You,
Jingsong
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(5), 2200-2202

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-74-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General procedure for the N-arylation of imidazoles with aryl iodides. An
oven-dried screw-cap test tube was charged with Cu2O (0.025 mmol), L
(0.075 mmol), imidazole (1.2 mmol), aryl iodide (1.00 mmol, if solid),
poly(ethylene glycol) (200 mg), Cs2CO3 (1.4 mmol), and a magnetic stir
bar. The reaction vessel was fitted with a rubber septum. The vessel was
evacuated and back-filled with argon or nitrogen, and this sequence was
repeated an additional time. Aryl iodide (1.00 mmol, if liquid) and
solvent (0.5 mL) were then added successively. The reaction tube was
sealed, and stirred in a pre-heated oil bath for the designated time
period. The reaction mixture was cooled to room temperature, diluted with
dichloromethane (10 mL), and filtered through a plug of celite, eluting
with additional dichloromethane (50 mL). The filtrate was concentrated
and the resulting residue was purified by flash chromatography to provide
the desired product. Experimental procedures for the N-arylation of
imidazole with aryl iodides. 1-Phenyl-1H-imidazole The general procedure
was followed using Cu2O (3.6 mg, 0.025 mmol), L (18 mg, 0.075 mmol), PEG
(200 mg), Cs2CO3 (0.45 g, 1.4 mmol), iodobenzene (112 μL, 1.00 mmol), and
imidazole (82 mg, 1.2 mmol), with NMP (0.5 mL) as solvent for 3 h at 110
°C. Chromatographic purification (hexane / ethyl acetate 1 : 3) afforded
1-phenyl-1H-imidazole (slightly yellow oil, 131 mg, 92 %). The low
catalyst loading experiment was preformed using the general procedure
with Cu2O (0.4 mg, 0.0025 mmol), L (1.8 mg, 0.0075 mmol), PEG (2.0 g),
Cs2CO3 (4.50 g, 14 mmol), iodobenzene (1.12 mL, 10 mmol), and imidazole
(820 mg, 12 mmol), in butyronitrile (2.0 mL) as solvent for 48 h at 110
°C. Chromatographic purification (hexane / ethyl acetate 1 : 3) provided
1- phenyl-1H-imidazole (slightly yellow oil, 1.34 g, 93 %). 1H NMR (300
MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.82 (s, 1H), 7.47-7.41 (m, 2H), 7.36-7.29 (m, 3H), 7.25
(bs, 1H), 7.18 (bs, 1H).3 A copy of the 1H NMR spectrum is provided.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM higher catalyst loading in the solvent of N-methylpyrrolidinone gave
similar yield in less reaction time
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM 4,7-Dimethoxy-1,10-phenanthroline: An excellent ligand for the
Cu-catalyzed N-arylation of imidazoles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Altman, Ryan A.; Buchwald, Stephen L.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organic Letters (2006), 8(13), 2779-2782

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):AMD
$DATUM polymer-supported
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: In an oven dried 100 mL RB flask, Cu-PAR (0.05
g, 0.0129 mmol), aryl halide (1 mmol), N-H heterocycles (1.2 mmol), K2CO3
(2 mmol), and 10 mL DMSO were stirred under nitrogen atmosphere, at 100
°C. The reaction mixtures were collected at different time interval and
identified by GCMS and quantified by GC analysis. After the completion of
the reaction, the catalyst was filtered off and washed with water
followed by acetone and dried in oven. The filtrate was extracted with
ethyl acetate (3 × 20 mL) and the combined organic layers were dried with
anhydrous Na2SO4 by vacuum. The filtrate was con- centrated by vacuum and
the resulting residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
to provide the desired product. 1-(4-Nitrophenyl)-1H-imidazole(E)., Time
(h): 12, Isolated Yield (%): 95. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.39 (d, 2H),
7.99 (bs, 1H), 7.58 (d, 2H), 7.38 (bs, 1H), 7.28 (bs, 1H); 13C NMR (100
MHz, CDCl3) δ 146.3, 141.9, 135.4, 131.7, 125.7, 121.0, 117.6.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM solid-supported catalyst, catalyst prepared and used, chloromethylated
polystyrene-supported copper(II) 4-(2-pyridylazo)resorcinol complex
catalyst used, alternative preparation shown
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM An Efficient Recyclable Polymer Supported Copper(II) Catalyst for C-N
Bond Formation by N-Arylation
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

Tuhina, Kazi; Mobarok, Manir; Paul, Sumantra; Salam, Noor; Hossain,
Dildar
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Catalysis Letters (2011), 141(8), 1171-1181

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: C-N Cross-Coupling Reactions; General
Procedure An oven-dried round-bottomed flask was charged with the amide
or imidazole (1.1 mmol), CuI (5 mol%), KOH (2.0 mmol), aryl halide (1.0
mmol), and TBAB (2.0 mmol) and the contents were stirred at 110 °C for
the appropriate time (Tables 2, 3). The reaction progress was monitored
by TLC using EtOAc and hexane (30:70 for amides; 80:20 for imidazoles) as
eluent. The reaction mixture was then cooled to r.t. and diluted with
EtOAc (10 mL). The resulting solu-tion was washed with brine (2 mL) and
H2O (2 × 2 mL). Drying (Na2SO4) and evaporation of the solvent gave a
residue, which was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
(230-400 mesh) using EtOAc and hexane (30:70 for amides; 80:20 for
imidazoles) as eluent. The C-N cross-coupled products (Tables 2, 3).
N-Phenylbenzamide 22 (Table 2, entry 1). 1-(4-Nitrophenyl)-1H-imidazole 9
(Table 3, entry 5). The title compound was prepared according to the
general procedure in 95 % yield. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 8.36 (d, J =
8.8 Hz, 2H), 7.96 (br s, 1H), 7.56 (d, J = 8.8 Hz, 2H), 7.36 (br s, 1H),
7.26 (br s, 1H). 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 146.4, 142.1, 135.6, 131.8,
125.9, 121.2, 117.8. Mp 203-205 °C (Lit.10 Mp 203-205 °C). FT-IR (KBr):
3106, 2962, 2851, 1599, 1511, 1340, 1306, 1262, 1108, 1052 cm-1.
Elemental analysis calcd (%) for C9H7N3O2: C 57.14, H 3.73, N 22.21,
found: C 57.18, H 3.71, N 22.25.

$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for N-arylation of nitrogen
nucleophiles: Imidazole (75.0 mg, 1.10 mmol), CuSO4·5H2O (25.0 mg, 0.1
mmol), 1,2-bis(2-pyridyl)-ethane-N,N’-dioxides (41.4 mg, 0.2 mmol), aryl
halide (1.00 mmol), Cs2CO3 (652 mg, 2.0 mmol) and water (3 mL) were put
into a Teflon septum screw-capped tube and then sealed in the air. The
reaction mixture was stirred at 120 °C for 24 h. After cooled to room
temperature, ethyl acetate was added to extract the coupling product and
results were determined by GC/MS. The pure N-arylated product was finally
obtained by column chromatography on silica gel. All the products were
confirmed by 1H NMR and 13C NMR spectroscopic analysis.
1-phenyl-1H-imidazole[1] (1) 1-(4-nitrophenyl)-1H-imidazole[4] (4)
Following the general procedure using 1H-imidazole (75 mg, 1.1 mmol) and
4-nitroiodobenzene (249 mg, 1 mmol) provided 179 mg (95% yield) of the
coupling product as a pale yellow solid after purification by flash
chromatography (ethyl acetate/petrol ether =1/1). 1H NMR (400 MHz,
CDCl3): δ 8.36-8.41 (s, 2H), 7.99 (s, 1H), 7.54-7.60 (m, 2H), 7.34 (s,
1H), 7.26 (s, 1H). 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3): 146.19, 141.97, 135.37,
131.73, 125.77, 121.05, 117.61. MS (EI, M/Z): 189 [M+].

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 1-(2-Nitrophenyl)-1H-imidazole (2e); Typical
Procedure. A mixture of 1-chloro-2-nitrobenzene (1 mmol), 1H-imidazole
(1.2 mmol), K2CO3 (1.2 mmol), and Cu/Al-HTB (100 mg, 2.5 mol%) in DMF (2
mL) was stirred in a round-bottomed flask at 100 °C. When the reaction
was complete (TLC), the catalyst was filtered washed several times with
DMF, H2O and acetone and reused for the next reaction. DMF was removed
from the reaction filtrate under reduced pressure and crude material was
purified by chromatography (silica gel, 60-120 mesh, hexane-EtOAc) to
afford 2e.11 Product 2d. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure. A flame-dried Schlenk test
tube with a magnetic stirring bar was charged with CuI (38.4 mg, 0.2
mmol), K3PO4 (0.422 g, 2.0 mmol), nitrogen-containing heterocycle (1.4
mmol), aryl halide (1.0 mmol), and DMF (1 mL) under N2 atmosphere. A
rubber septum was replaced with a glass stopper, and the system was then
evacuated twice and back filled with N2. After being stirred at 35-40 °C
for 40 h, the reaction mixture was diluted with 2-3 mL of ethyl acetate,
filtered through a plug of silica gel, and washed with 10-20 mL of ethyl
acetate. The filtrate was concentrated and the resulting residue was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel to provide the desired
product. 1-(4-Nitrophenyl)-1H-imidazole (3o)3-5 Following the general
procedure, the crude product was purified over a silica gel column using
ethyl acetate/petroleum ether (1/1) to give a pale yellow solid (94%
yield). 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 7.27 (s, 1H), 7.34 (s, 1H), 7.53 (d, J
= 8.0 Hz, 2H), 7.80 (d, J = 8.4 Hz, 2H), 8.00 (s, 1H) ppm. 13C NMR (150
MHz, CDCl3): δ 117.6, 121.0, 125.7, 131.7, 135.4, 141.9, 146.2 ppm. GC-MS
(EI, m/z): 189 [M+].
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for the N-arylation of
nitrogen nucleophiles Imidazole (163.4 mg, 2.40 mmol), 38.1 mg CuI (0.20
mmol), 143.4 mg 1,4-bis(2-hydroxy-5-methoxybenzyl)piperazine (0.40 mmol),
aryl halide (2.00 mmol), 225 mg KOH (4.0 mmol), 64.4 mg (n-Bu)4NBr (0.20
mmol), and 2 cm 3 water were put into a Teflon septum screw-capped tube
and then sealed in the air. The reaction mixture was stirred at 120 °C
for 12 h. After cooling to room temperature, ethyl acetate (3 x 1 cm3)
was added to extract the coupling product and results were determined by
GC. The pure N-arylated product was obtained by column chromatography on
silica gel. All products were known and characterized by 1H NMR
spectroscopy, the data were found to be identical with those reported in
the literature. 1-(4-nitrophenyl)-1H-imidazole[4] (3c) Following the
general produce, using 1H-imidazole(163 mg, 2.4 mmol) and
4-nitroiodobenzene (498 mg, 2 mmol) provided 350 mg (93% yield) of the
coupling product as a pale yellow solid after purification by flash
chromatography (eluent: petrol ether/ethyl acetate = 1/1). Mp: 203-205 °C
(lit 204.4-205.2 °C)[9] 1H NMR ( 300 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 8.36-8.43 (m, 2H),
8.03 (s, 1H), 7.58-7.67 (m, 2H), 7.41 (br s, 1H), 7.28 (br s, 1H) ppm. MS
( EI , M/Z): 189 [M+], 143, 116, 89, 76.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM green chemistry, green chemistry (protocol), green chemistry-solvent,
sealed tube used, alternative preparation shown
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

of imidazoles in water
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Zhu, Yefeng; Shi, Yixing; Wei, Yunyang
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Monatshefte fuer Chemie (2010), 141(9), 1009-1013

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 9003-53-6
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(2):AMD
$DATUM nitrated, reduced, copper diacetate complex of Schiff base with
2-pyridinecarboxaldehyde
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-56-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General procedure for the N-arylation of N(H)-heterocycles with
arylboronic acids catalyzed by heterogeneous copper(II) Schiff base
catalyst In a 100 mL RB flask, copper(II) catalyst (0.05 g, 0.0156 mmol),
aryl boronic acid (1.5 mmol), N(H)-heterocycles (1.2 mmol), and MeOH (10
mL) were stirred under open air, at 40 °C. To study the progress of the
reaction, the reaction mixtures were collected at different time
intervals and quantified by GC analysis. After the completion of the
reaction, the catalyst was filtered off, washed with water followed by
acetone, and oven dried. Then, it was extracted with ethyl acetate (3 x
20 mL), and the combined organic layers were dried with anhydrous Na2SO4.
The filtrate was concentrated by vacuum, and the resulting residue was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel to provide the desired
product. 1-Phenyl-1H-imidazole (A), yield 95%. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ
= 7.82 (s, 1H), 7.54-7.42 (m, 2H), 7.41-7.40 (m, 3H), 7.27 (bs, 1H), 7.24
(bs, 1H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 136.4, 134.5, 130.5, 129.0, 126.9,
121.1, 118.2.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM solid-supported catalyst, polymer-supported copper(II) schiff base
complex prepared and used as catalyst, catalyst recyclable, alternative
preparations shown
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM An efficient polymer-supported copper(II) catalyst for the N-arylation
reaction of N(H)-heterocycles with aryl halides as well as arylboronic
acids
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Islam, Manirul; Mondal, Sanchita; Mondal, Paramita; Roy, Anupam Singha;
Tuhina, Kazi; Salam, Noor; Paul, Sumantra; Hossain, Dildar; Mobarok,
Manir
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Transition Metal Chemistry (Dordrecht, Netherlands) (2011), 36(4),
447-458

$DATUM 1317-39-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-56-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM N-Arylation of Azoles with Arylboronic Acid at Ambient Conditions;
General Procedure. Cu2O (0.055 mmol) was added to a mixture of azole (1.2
mmol) and arylboronic acid (1 mmol) in MeOH (3 mL) at r.t., and the
mixture was stirred for 5 h under an atmosphere of air. The progress of
the reaction was monitored by TLC and on completion of the reaction, the
mixture was centrifuged and the centrifugate was concentrated under
reduced pressure to give the crude product. The crude product was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel (hexane-EtOAc, 70:30) to
afford the N-arylated azoles. 1-Phenyl-1H-imidazole (Table 1, entry 1),
yield 95%. IR (film): 3424, 3117, 1600, 1509, 1304, 1253, 1110, 1058,
908, 760, 690, 659, 520 cm-1. 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 7.83 (s, 1 H),
7.50-7.30 (m, 5 H), 7.25 (br s, 1 H), 7.18 (br s, 1 H). 13C NMR (75 MHz,
CDCl3): δ = 137.3, 135.7, 130.3, 129.9, 127.5, 121.5, 118.3. EI-MS: m/z =
144 (100%), 117, 77, 51. HRMS: m/z calcd for C9H8N2 (M+): 144.069; found:
144.069.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM catalyst reusable
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Copper(I) oxide-catalyzed N-arylation of azoles and amines with
arylboronic acid at room temperature under base-free conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Sreedhar, Bojja; Venkanna, Gopaladasu T.; Kumar, Kota Balaji Shiva;
Balasubrahmanyam, Vura
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2008), (5), 795-799

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Copper-Catalyzed
Coupling of Nitrogen Heterocycles and Aryl Bromides A flame-dried Schlenk
test tube with a magnetic stirring bar was charged with CuBr (14 mg, 0.1
mmol), ligand (30 mg, 0.2 mmol), Cs2CO3 (652 mg, 2.0 mmol), amine or
nitrogen-containing heterocycle (1.0 mmol), aryl halide (1.2 mmol) and
DMSO (1 mL) under N2. After the reaction mixture was heated at 80°C for
12 h or at 90°C for 24 h, the reaction mixture was cooled to ambient
temperature, diluted with 2-3 mL of ethyl acetate, filtered through a
plug of silica gel, and washed with 10 mL of ethyl acetate. The filtrate
was concentrated and the resulting residue was purified by column
chromatography on silica gel (ethyl acetate/petroleum ether) to provide
the desired product. 1-(4-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)phenyl)ethanone (2k)
Following the general procedure, imidazole (68 mg, 1.0 mmol) was coupled
with 4-bromoacetophenone (239 mg, 1.2 mmol) at the indicated condition.
The crude product was purified over a silica gel column using ethyl
acetate/petrol ether (1/2-2:1, v/v) giving slight yellow solid, Yield 95%
1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.10 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 2H), 8.1 (bs, 1H), 7.52
(d, J = 8.0 Hz, 2H), 7.4 (bs, 2H), 2.65 (s, 3H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3)
δ 196.6, 141.0, 135.8, 131.7, 130.4, 120.8, 20.7; GC-MS (EI, m/z) 186
[M+].6
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM 1,2,3,4-Tetrahydro-8-hydroxyquinoline-promoted copper-catalyzed coupling
of nitrogen nucleophiles and aryl bromides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Wang, Huifeng; Li, Yaming; Sun, Fangfang; Feng, Yang; Jin, Kun; Wang,
Xiuna
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2008), 73(21), 8639-8642

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for N-Arylation of Imidazole
with Aryl Bromides. A Schlenk tube equipped with a Teflon stopcock are
charged with a magnetic stir bar, K2CO3 (572 mg, 2.1 mmol), CuI (0.38 mg,
0.20 mmol, 20 mol %), and per-6-amino- β -cyclodextrin (100 mg, 0.08
mmol, 8 mol %). DMSO (1 mL) was added at room temperature. Then a
solution of bromobenzene (188 mg, 1.2 mmol) and imidazole (68 mg, 1.0
mmol) in DMSO (1 mL) was added. The tube was sealed and the mixture was
allowed to stir for 24 h at 110°C. Water (5 mL) was added to the reaction
mixture after completion of the reaction. Then it was extracted with
ethyl acetate (3 × 20 mL) and the combined organic layers were dried with
anhydrous Na2SO4 and concentrated by vacuum. The residue was purified by
column chromatography on silica gel, using hexane/ethyl acetate (1:3) as
eluant, to give an oil of 1-phenylimidazole 4a (164 mg, 98%)
1-(4-(1H-Imidazol-1-yl)phenyl)ethanone (4d), yield 94% 1H NMR (300 MHz):
8.08 (d, 2H), 7.95 (bs, 1H), 7.49 (d, 2H), 7.35 (bs, 1H), 7.24 (bs, 1H),
2.63 (s, 3H) 13C NMR (75 MHz):196.4, 140.7, 135.7, 135.4, 131.0, 130.3,
120.6, 117.7, 26.5 GC-MS: m/z 185.9 (M+)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM sealed tube used, Ullmann reaction
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Per-6-amino-β-cyclodextrin as an Efficient Supramolecular Ligand and Host
for Cu(I)-Catalyzed N-Arylation of Imidazole with Aryl Bromides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Suresh, Palaniswamy; Pitchumani, Kasi
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2008), 73(22), 9121-9124

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 2. Procedure for ultrasound-promoted
iodination of aromatic and heteroaromatic compounds. To a suspension of
the appropriate aromatic or heteroaromatic compound (1a-q) (2 mmol) and
molecular iodine (2-4 mmol) in distilled water (10 mL) was added hydrogen
peroxide 30% (m/v) (4-8 mmol). The mixture was sonicated and the progress
of reaction was monitored by TLC. Afterwards, a saturated sodium
thiosulfate aqueous solution (10 mL) was added to the mixture, which was
extracted with ethyl acetate (3 × 20 mL). The organic phase was dried
over MgSO4. After filtration, the solvent was evaporated under reduced
pressure. The residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
using an appropriate eluent, affording the desired product (2a-q).
2,4,5-Triiodo-1H-imidazole (2o). Yield: 0.8470 g (95%); off-white solid.
Reactant: aromatic compound 1o, I2/H2O2: 2/4 equivalents, Time: 30 mins.
mp 180-183°C (CH2Cl2 as eluent) (lit. 180-183°C); IR (KBr, cm-1): 3421,
1804, 1508, 974, 656; 1H NMR 300 MHz (DMSO-d6, ppm): 13.33 (s, 1H); 13C
NMR 75 MHz (DMSO-d6, ppm): 89.5; EI-MS (m/z, %): 446 (100.0), 319 (37.9),
127 (20.8), 129 (7.9).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM green chemistry, ultrasound
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Ultrasound-Promoted Rapid and Efficient Iodination of Aromatic and
Heteroaromatic Compounds in the Presence of Iodine and Hydrogen Peroxide
in Water
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Ferreira, Irlon M.; Casagrande, Gleison A.; Pizzuti, Lucas; Raminelli,
Cristiano
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthetic Communications (2014), 44(14), 2094-2102

$DATUM 94
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 584-08-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1017605-84-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Typical Experimental Procedure of N-Arylation Under Homogeneous
Conditions Catalyst 1f (0.007 g, 1 mol%), K2CO3 (0.276 g, 2 mmol) were
added to a mixture of 1-chloro-4-nitrobenzene (0.158 g, 1 mmol) and
imidazole (0.081 g, 1.2 mmol) in 3 mL of DMF. The reaction mixture was
heated at 110 °C under stirring for 1.5 h. After cooling to ambient
temperature, the resulting mixture was added with 4 mL of ethyl acetate
and 10 mL of water. The organic layer was separated, and the aqueous
layer was further extracted with ethyl acetate (10 mL). The combined
organic phase was washed with brine and dried over Na2SO4. The solvent
was removed under vacuum, and the residue was further purified by
flash-column chromatography on silica gel to afford the product
1-(4-nitrophenyl)-1H-imidazole in 94% yield.
1-(4-nitrophenyl)-1H-imidazole, yield 94%. Mp 203 °C; 1H NMR (300 MHz,

$DATUM 935547-46-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Catalytic
N-Arylation of Nitrogen-Containing Heterocycles with Aryl Halides. A
flame-dried Schlenk test tube with a magnetic stirring bar was charged
with CuI (9.6 mg, 0.05 mmol), ligand (0.1 mmol), Cs2CO3 (0.652 g, 2.0
mmol), nitrogen-containing heterocycle (1.0 mmol), aryl or heteroaryl
halide (1.2 mmol), and DMF (2 mL) under N2. A rubber septum was replaced
with a glass stopper, and the system was then evacuated twice and back
filled with N2. The reaction mixture was stirred for 30 min at room
temperature, and then heated to 110 °C for 24 h. The reaction mixture was
then cooled to ambient temperature, diluted with 2-3 mL of ethyl acetate,
filtered through a plug of silica gel, and washed with 10-20 mL of ethyl
acetate. The filtrate was concentrated and the resulting residue was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel to provide the desired
product. 1-Phenyl-1H-imidazole (7a) 2 1H NMR (600 MHz, CDCl3): δ 7.25 (s,
1 H), 7.32 (s, 1H), 7.38-7.41 (m, 3H), 7.49-7.51 (m, 2H), 7.92 (s, 1H)
ppm. 13C NMR (150 MHz, CDCl3): δ 118.3, 121.5, 127.5, 129.9, 130.3,
135.7, 137.3 ppm. GC-MS (EI, m/z): 144 [M+].
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM other catalysts gave higher yield
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Highly Efficient Copper-Catalyzed N-Arylation of Nitrogen-Containing
Heterocycles with Aryl and Heteroaryl Halides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Zhu, Liangbo; Cheng, Liang; Zhang, Yuxi; Xie, Rugang; You, Jingsong
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2007), 72(8), 2737-2743

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Coupling Reaction A
Schlenk tube with a magnetic stirring bar was charged with imidazole (2.4
mmol), K2CO3 (4.2 mmol), CuI (0.16 mmol, 10 mol%), aryl halide (2.0
mmol), and PEG (3 mL). The tube was sealed after being evacuated twice
and back filled with N2. The mixture was stirred at 110°C for 24 h,
cooled to room temperature, and extracted with diethyl ether (5×10mL).
The upper layers were decanted, combined, and concentrated to the crude
product, which was analyzed by GC-MS. The PEG phase of the lower layer
was subjected to a second run with the same substrates. Further
purification of the product was achieved by flash chromatography on a
silica-gel column. All the products, which are known compounds, were
characterized and compared with authentic compounds previously reported
in the literatures.[9a,9b,12,15] 1-Phenyl-1H-imidazole (Table 2, Entry
4). 1H NMR (300MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.85 (s, 1H), 7.50-7.45 (m, 2H), 7.40-7.34
(m, 3H), 7.27 (s, 1H), 7.20 (s, 1H). GC-MS (EI, m/z): 144.0 [M+].
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM green chemistry
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Efficient and Reusable Catalytic System of CuI-PEG for N-Arylation of
Imidazoles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Zhang, Qiang; Luo, Jun; Wei, Yunyang
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthetic Communications (2012), 42(1), 114-121

$DATUM 67-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Imidazole (0.51 g, 7.5 mmol, 1.5 equiv), KOH (0.56 g, 10 mmol, 2 equiv),
and Cu2O (72 mg, 0.5 mmol, 0.1 equiv) were added to a flask. The flask
was then sealed with septum, evacuated, and backfilled with nitrogen.
DMSO (10 mL) and 2-bromopyridine (0.48 mL, 5 mmol, 1 equiv) were added to
the flask, and the mixture was heated at 120 °C for 36 h. After the
mixture was cooled to ambient temperature, water was added, and the
aqueous phase was extracted with CH2Cl2 (3 × 25 mL). The combined organic
layers were dried over MgSO4. The crude product was purified by column
chromatography over a short plug of silica with EtOAc as eluent.
1-(2-Pyridyl)imidazole was obtained as a yellow oil (0.68g, 4.7 mmol,
94%).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM sealed flask used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Charged Bis-Cyclometalated Iridium(III) Complexes with Carbene-Based
Ancillary Ligands
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Monti, Filippo; Kessler, Florian; Delgado, Manuel; Frey, Julien;
Bazzanini, Federico; Accorsi, Gianluca; Armaroli, Nicola; Bolink, Henk
J.; Orti, Enrique; Scopelliti, Rosario; Nazeeruddin, Khaja Md.; Baranoff,
Etienne
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Inorganic Chemistry (2013), 52(18), 10292-10305

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Catalytic
N-Arylation of Nitrogen- Containing Heterocycles with Aryl and Heteroaryl
Halides. A flamedried Schlenk test tube with a magnetic stirring bar was
charged with CuI (9.5 mg, 0.05 mmol), 4a-2 (145 mg, 0.1 mmol of the
L-proline unit), K2CO3 (165 mg, 1.2 mmol), nitrogen-containing
heterocycle (0.5 mmol), aryl or heteroaryl halide (0.6 mmol), and DMSO (2
mL) under N2. A rubber septum was replaced with a glass stopper, and the
system was then evacuated three times and backfilled with N2. The
reaction mixture was stirred for 30 min at room temperature and then
heated at 120 °C for 60 h. The resulting mixture was cooled to ambient
temperature, diluted with 2-3 mL of ethyl acetate, filtered through a
plug of silica gel, and washed with 10-20 mL of ethyl acetate. The
filtrate was concentrated, and the resulting residue was purified by
column chromatography on silica gel to provide the desired product.
2-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)pyrimidine (6r)5 Following the general procedure,
imidazole (0.034 g, 0.5 mmol) was coupled with 2-chloropyrimidine (69 mg,
0.6 mmol). The crude product was purified over a silica gel column using
ethyl acetate/petrol ether (1/1) to give white solid (94% yield). 1H NMR
(400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 7.10 (s, 1H), 7.14 (t, J = 4.8 Hz, 1H), 7.82 (s, 1H),
8.55 (s, 1H), 8.61 (d, J = 5.2 Hz, 2H) ppm. 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3): δ
116.4, 118.7, 130.5, 136.0, 158.6 ppm. GC-MS (EI, m/z): 146 [M+].
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM solid-supported catalyst (polymer-supported ionic liq.-copper complex)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM A Concept of Supported Amino Acid Ionic Liquids and Their Application in
Metal Scavenging and Heterogeneous Catalysis
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Chen, Wen; Zhang, Yuanyuan; Zhu, Liangbo; Lan, Jingbo; Xie, Rugang; You,
Jingsong
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of the American Chemical Society (2007), 129(45), 13879-13886

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Preparation of 1-(trimethylsilyl) imidazole: Imidazole (6.81 g, 100 mmol)
and 1,1,1,3,3,3-hexamethyldisilazane (12.3 g, 76.1 mmol) were charged
into a flame three necked 100 mL flask connected to a condenser. The
mixture was refluxed under positive nitrogen pressure for 10 hr 30 min.
The mixture was cooled to rt, and distilled under reduced pressure (52-54
degC/0.7 mm Hg). The product can be distilled under house vacuum, but
high vacuum was more efficient. Previously reported 1-(trimethylsilyl)
imidazole (10.1 g, 94 %) was collected as a colorless liquid. Colorless
liquid. bp 115-117 degC/Ca. 30 mm Hg, 80-82 degC/4 mm Hg, or 52-54
degC/0.7 mm Hg ([108] 97 degC/12 mm Hg). The reagent was redistilled
before further reaction.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM PartI. Synthesis of N-heterocyclic furanosides and pyranosides via 5- or
6-exo-trig-radical cyclizations. Part II. (a) Palladium catalyzed
silystannylative cyclization of diynes and allenynes (b) Regioselective
Diels-Alder reaction of vinylsilane and its application to Papulacandin D
core structure
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Rhee, Jong Uk
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM (2004), 66(11), 477 pages

$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 2-Imidazol-1-yl-benzylamine (58). To a solution of 1H-imidazole (0.61 g,
9.0 mmol) in DMF (8 mL) was added sodium hydride (60% in oil, 0.36 g, 9.0
mmol), and the reaction mixture was stirred at room temperature for 40
min. 2-Fluorobenzonitrile (0.9 mL, 8.2 mmol) was added, and the reaction
was stirred at room temperature for 45 min, heated to 60 °C for 45 min,
and then stirred at room temperature overnight. Ethyl acetate was added,
and the mixture was washed with water and brine. Drying and solvent
evaporation gave 2-imidazol-1-yl-benzonitrile (1.3 g, 93%).
2-imidazol-1-yl-benzonitrile, yield (1.3 g, 93%). 1H NMR (CDCl3, 400
MHz): δ 7.86 (br s, 1H), 7.84 (m, 1H), 7.75 (m, 1H), 7.54 (m, 1H), 7.47
(dd, J = 8.1 Hz, J = 1 Hz, 1H), 7.36 (m, 1H), 7.27 (m, 1H).

$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1317-39-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-56-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: N-Arylation of Azoles with Arylboronic Acid at
Ambient Conditions; General Procedure. Cu2O (0.055 mmol) was added to a
mixture of azole (1.2 mmol) and arylboronic acid (1 mmol) in MeOH (3 mL)
at r.t., and the mixture was stirred for 5 h under an atmosphere of air.
The progress of the reaction was monitored by TLC and on completion of
the reaction, the mixture was centrifuged and the centrifugate was
concentrated under reduced pressure to give the crude product. The crude
product was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
(hexane-EtOAc, 70:30) to afford the N-arylated azoles.
1-(4-Methylphenyl)-1H-imidazole (Table 1, entry 2), yield 95%. IR (film):
3391, 3115, 2924, 1612, 1522, 1488, 1304, 1249, 1112, 1058, 964, 908,
816, 735, 661, 616, 523 cm-1. 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 7.76 (s, 1 H),
7.24 (m, 4 H), 7.19 (br s, 1 H), 7.13 (br s, 1 H), 2.39 (s, 3 H). 13C NMR
(75 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 137.4, 135.5, 134.9, 130.3, 130.1, 121.3, 118.3,
20.9. EI-MS: m/z = 158 (100%), 131, 104, 91, 50.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM catalyst reusable
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1311157-16-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):AMD
$DATUM polymer-supported
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-56-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: In a 100 mL RB flask, Cu-PAR (0.05 g, 0.0129
mmol), arylboronic acid (1 mmol), N-H heterocycles (1.2 mmol), and 10 mL
methanol were stirred under nitrogen atmosphere, at 40 °C. The reaction
mixtures were collected at different time interval and identified by GCMS
and quantified by GC analysis. After the completion of the reaction, the
catalyst was filtered off and washed with water fol- lowed by acetone and
dried in oven. The filtrate was extracted with ethyl acetate (3 × 20 mL)
and the com- bined organic layers were dried with anhydrous Na2SO4 by
vacuum. The filtrate was concentrated by vacuum and the resulting residue
was purified by column chromatography on silica gel to provide the
desired product. 1-(4-Methylphenyl)-1H-imidazole (B). Time (h): 14,
Isolated Yield (%): 93. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.76 (s, 1H), 7.24 (m,
4H), 7.19 (bs, 1H), 7.13 (bs, 1H), 2.39 (s, 3H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3)
δ 137.4, 135.5, 134.8, 130.3, 130.0, 121.3, 118.3, 20.90.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM solid-supported catalyst, catalyst prepared and used, chloromethylated
polystyrene-supported copper(II) 4-(2-pyridylazo)resorcinol complex
catalyst used, alternative preparation shown
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM An Efficient Recyclable Polymer Supported Copper(II) Catalyst for C-N
Bond Formation by N-Arylation

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 9003-53-6
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(2):AMD
$DATUM nitrated, reduced, copper diacetate complex of Schiff base with
2-pyridinecarboxaldehyde
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 67-56-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for the N-arylation of
N(H)-heterocycles with arylboronic acids catalyzed by heterogeneous
copper(II) Schiff base catalyst In a 100 mL RB flask, copper(II) catalyst
(0.05 g, 0.0156 mmol), aryl boronic acid (1.5 mmol), N(H)-heterocycles
(1.2 mmol), and MeOH (10 mL) were stirred under open air, at 40 °C. To
study the progress of the reaction, the reaction mixtures were collected
at different time intervals and quantified by GC analysis. After the
completion of the reaction, the catalyst was filtered off, washed with
water followed by acetone, and oven dried. Then, it was extracted with
ethyl acetate (3 x 20 mL), and the combined organic layers were dried
with anhydrous Na2SO4. The filtrate was concentrated by vacuum, and the
resulting residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel to
provide the desired product. 1-(4-Methylphenyl)-1H-imidazole (B) [39],
yield 93% 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 7.78 (s, 1H), 7.22 (m, 4H), 7.17
(bs, 1H), 7.13 (bs, 1H), 2.42 (s, 3H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) 137.2,
135.7, 134.4, 130.1, 130.3, 121.6, 118.0, 20.90.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM solid-supported catalyst, polymer-supported copper(II) schiff base
complex prepared and used as catalyst, catalyst recyclable, alternative
preparations shown
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM An efficient polymer-supported copper(II) catalyst for the N-arylation
reaction of N(H)-heterocycles with aryl halides as well as arylboronic
acids
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Islam, Manirul; Mondal, Sanchita; Mondal, Paramita; Roy, Anupam Singha;
Tuhina, Kazi; Salam, Noor; Paul, Sumantra; Hossain, Dildar; Mobarok,
Manir
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Transition Metal Chemistry (Dordrecht, Netherlands) (2011), 36(4),
447-458

$DATUM 67-56-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: N-Arylation of Azoles with Arylboronic Acid at
Ambient Conditions; General Procedure. Cu2O (0.055 mmol) was added to a
mixture of azole (1.2 mmol) and arylboronic acid (1 mmol) in MeOH (3 mL)
at r.t., and the mixture was stirred for 5 h under an atmosphere of air.
The progress of the reaction was monitored by TLC and on completion of
the reaction, the mixture was centrifuged and the centrifugate was
concentrated under reduced pressure to give the crude product. The crude
product was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
(hexane-EtOAc, 70:30) to afford the N-arylated azoles.
1-(4-Methoxyphenyl)-1H-imidazole (Table 1, entry 3), yield 95%. IR
(film): 3415, 2928, 1675, 1520, 1464, 1302, 1250, 1181, 1113, 1059, 1029,
833, 764, 661, 614, 536 cm-1. 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 7.71 (s, 1 H),
7.28 (d, J= 9.0 Hz, 2 H), 7.15 (br s, 1 H), 7.11 (br s, 1 H), 6.94 (d, J=
9.0 Hz, 2 H), 3.83 (s, 3 H). 13C NMR (75 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 159.0, 135.8,
130, 130.8, 123 (2 C), 118.5, 114.6, (2 C), 55.2. EI-MS: m/z = 174
(100%), 159, 147, 132, 120, 77. HRMS: m/z calcd for C10H10N2O (M+):
174.079; found: 174.078.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM catalyst reusable
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Copper(I) oxide-catalyzed N-arylation of azoles and amines with
arylboronic acid at room temperature under base-free conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Sreedhar, Bojja; Venkanna, Gopaladasu T.; Kumar, Kota Balaji Shiva;
Balasubrahmanyam, Vura
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2008), (5), 795-799

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 1-(2-Nitrophenyl)-1H-imidazole (2e); Typical
Procedure. A mixture of 1-chloro-2-nitrobenzene (1 mmol), 1H-imidazole
(1.2 mmol), K2CO3 (1.2 mmol), and Cu/Al-HTB (100 mg, 2.5 mol%) in DMF (2
mL) was stirred in a round-bottomed flask at 100 °C. When the reaction
was complete (TLC), the catalyst was filtered washed several times with
DMF, H2O and acetone and reused for the next reaction. DMF was removed
from the reaction filtrate under reduced pressure and crude material was
purified by chromatography (silica gel, 60-120 mesh, hexane-EtOAc) to
afford 2e.11 Product 2h. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM green chemistry-catalyst
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

N(H)-heterocyclic amines

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for C-N Cross-Coupling
Reaction and XPS, FTIR and XRD spectras of Fe/Cg General Procedure for
the Iron Catalyzed C-N Cross-Coupling: 1H-Pyrazole (2; 68 mg, 1 mmol),
Fe/Cg (116 mg, 5 wt%), KOH (2.5 equiv) and iodobenzene (1; 0.1 mL, 1
mmol) were charged in a 25 mL round bottom flask with a condenser under
nitrogen atmosphere, followed by dry DMSO (1.5 mL). The round bottom
flask was flushed and sealed under nitrogen atmosphere and the mixture
was heated in an oil bath at 120 °C and stirred at this temperature for
24 hours. After completion of the reaction as monitored by TLC, the
heterogeneous mixture was then cooled to room temperature and treated
with water (2 mL). The aqueous layer was separated and extracted with
ethyl acetate (3x5 mL). The combined organic layers were dried with
anhydrous Na2SO4 and concentrated under reduced pressure to yield the
product, which was purified by silica gel column chromatography (with
ethyl acetate and hexane as eluent) to get 3a (134 mg, 95%) as a pale
yellow oil. 1-p-tolyl-1H-imidazole 7(entry 6, compound 7b). 149 mg (94%
yield),whitecrystalline solid. mp: 63-65 °C. IR (KBr) ν (max) 2852, 1903,
1678, 1506, 1055, 892, 758 cm-1. 1H NMR (200MHz, CDCl3): δ = 7.26 (s,
1H), 6.74 - 6.57 (m, 6H), 2.37 (s, 3H). 13C NMR (50MHz, CDCl3): δ =
139.9, 137.4, 135.3, 129.5, 128.1, 121.2, 118.4, 29.5. ESI-MS m/z : 159
[M+H].
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM solid-supported catalyst
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Recyclable Heterogeneous Iron Catalyst for C-N Cross-Coupling under
Ligand-Free Conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Swapna, K.; Vijay Kumar, A.; Prakash Reddy, V.; Rama Rao, K.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(19), 7514-7517

$DATUM 1317-39-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Solvent-Free, Copper-Catalyzed N-Arylation of
a Nitrogen- Containing Heterocycle; General Procedure A mixture of
nitrogen-containing heterocycle 1 (0.5 mmol), aryl or heteroaryl halide 2
(0.6 mmol), cubic Cu2O nanoparticles (5-10 mol%), 1,10-phenanthroline
(L2; 10-20 mol%), and TBAF (1.5 mmol) was stirred at 110-145 °C for 24-48
h until complete consumption of the starting material was observed
(monitored by TLC). After completion of the reaction, EtOAc (10 mL) was
poured into the mixture, which was then washed with sat. aq NaCl (3 × 5
mL) and extracted with Et2O (2 × 10 mL). The organic layers were then
dried (anhyd Na2SO4) and evaporated under vacuum. The residue was
purified by flash column chromatography (EtOAc or hexane-EtOAc) to afford
the desired product. 1-(4-Tolyl)-1H-imidazole (22)17j, yield 94%. 1H NMR
(400 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 7.88 (br s, 1 H), 7.25 (br s, 6 H), 2.38 (s, 3 H).
13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 157.8, 137.2, 134.8, 130.1, 121.1, 20.7.
LRMS (EI, 70 eV): m/z (%) = 158 (M+, 100).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM nanoparticle Cu⊂2O as catalyst
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM N-arylations of nitrogen-containing heterocycles with aryl and heteroaryl
halides using a copper(I) oxide nanoparticle/1,10-phenanthroline
catalytic system
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Tang, Bo-Xiao; Guo, Sheng-Mei; Zhang, Man-Bo; Li, Jin-Heng
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2008), (11), 1707-1716

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7681-65-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure. A flame-dried Schlenk test
tube with a magnetic stirring bar was charged with CuI (38.4 mg, 0.2
mmol), K3PO4 (0.422 g, 2.0 mmol), nitrogen-containing heterocycle (1.4
mmol), aryl halide (1.0 mmol), and DMF (1 mL) under N2 atmosphere. A
rubber septum was replaced with a glass stopper, and the system was then
evacuated twice and back filled with N2. After being stirred at 35-40 °C
for 40 h, the reaction mixture was diluted with 2-3 mL of ethyl acetate,
filtered through a plug of silica gel, and washed with 10-20 mL of ethyl
acetate. The filtrate was concentrated and the resulting residue was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel to provide the desired
product. 1-(4-Methoxyphenyl)-1H-imidazole (3p)3-5 Following the general
procedure, the crude product was purified over a silica gel column using
ethyl acetate/petroleum ether (1/1) to give a white solid (95% yield). 1H
NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 3.87 (s, 3H), 6.99-7.02 (m, 2H), 7.21 (s, 1H),
7.23 (s, 1H), 7.29-7.34 (m, 2H), 7.80 (s, 1H) ppm. 13C NMR (150 MHz,
CDCl3): δ 55.6, 114.8, 118.7, 123.18, 130.0, 130.7, 135.8, 158.9 ppm.
GC-MS (EI, m/z): 174 [M+].
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Highly Functional Group Tolerance in Copper-Catalyzed N-Arylation of
Nitrogen-Containing Heterocycles under Mild Conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Zhu, Liangbo; Li, Gaocan; Luo, Liang; Guo, Peng; Lan, Jingbo; You,
Jingsong
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(5), 2200-2202

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME28 STEP1

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure To a solution of diazole (3
mmol) and aryl iodides (1 mmol) in xylene (3 mL) under argon atmosphere
were added CuI (38 mg, 20 mol%) and 1,10-phenanthroline (40 mg, 20 mol%)
followed by KF/Al2O320 (5 equiv, 780 mg) and stirred at 130-140 °C for
specified times (Table 1). The progress of the reaction was monitored by
TLC. The reaction mixture allowed to cool to r.t. and was then
partitioned between CH2Cl2 (30 mL) and sat. aq NH4Cl (3 × 10 mL). The
organic phase was washed with H2O (3 × 10 mL), dried (Na2SO4), filtered
and concentrated. The crude product was purified by column chromatography
on silica gel using hexane-EtOAc as eluent (9:1). Table 1, Entry 5: brown
solid, yield 94%. mp 60-62 °C (Lit.9b 60-61 °C). 1H NMR (90 MHz, CDCl3):
δ = 7.7 (1 H, br s), 7.3-7.1 (4 H, m), 7.12 (1 H, s), 6.8 (1 H, s), 3.9
(3 H, s). Anal. Calcd for C10H10N2O: C, 68.94; H, 5.78; N, 16.08. Found:
C, 68.71; H, 5.67; N, 16.01.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM solid-supported reaction
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Highly efficient copper-catalyzed formation of N-aryl diazoles using
KF/Al2O3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Hosseinzadeh, Rahman; Tajbakhsh, Mahmood; Alikarami, Mohammad
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2006), (13), 2124-2126

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1643-19-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: C-N Cross-Coupling Reactions; General
Procedure An oven-dried round-bottomed flask was charged with the amide
or imidazole (1.1 mmol), CuI (5 mol%), KOH (2.0 mmol), aryl halide (1.0
mmol), and TBAB (2.0 mmol) and the contents were stirred at 110 °C for
the appropriate time (Tables 2, 3). The reaction progress was monitored
by TLC using EtOAc and hexane (30:70 for amides; 80:20 for imidazoles) as
eluent. The reaction mixture was then cooled to r.t. and diluted with
EtOAc (10 mL). The resulting solu-tion was washed with brine (2 mL) and
H2O (2 × 2 mL). Drying (Na2SO4) and evaporation of the solvent gave a
residue, which was purified by column chromatography on silica gel
(230-400 mesh) using EtOAc and hexane (30:70 for amides; 80:20 for
imidazoles) as eluent. The C-N cross-coupled products (Tables 2, 3).
N-Phenylbenzamide 22 (Table 2, entry 1). 1-(4-Methylphenyl)-1H-imidazole
9 (Table 3, entry 4). The title compound was prepared according to the
general procedure in 93 % yield. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ = 7.82 (s,
1H), 7.28-7.26 (m, 5H), 7.19 (s, 1H), 2.41 (s, 3H). 13C NMR (100 MHz,
CDCl3) δ = 137.7, 135.9, 135.3, 130.6, 130.4, 121.7, 118.6, 21.2. FT-IR
(KBr): 3419, 2927, 2851, 1599, 1518, 1454, 1380, 1300, 1251, 1229, 1174,
1034 cm-1. Elemental analysis calcd (%) for C10H10N2: C 75.92, H 6.37, N
17.71, found: C 75.96, H 6.35, N 17.69.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Efficient copper-catalyzed N-arylation of amides and imidazoles with aryl
iodides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Ali, Ashif Md.; Saha, Prasenjit; Punniyamurthy, Tharmalingam
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2010), (6), 908-910

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Step 1 Preparation of methyl 3-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)propanoate To a solution
of 1H-imidazole (1.000 g, 14.7 mmol) in acetonitrile (20 mL) in a
pressure tube is added methyl acrylate (2.65 mL, 29.4 mmol). The tube is
sealed and heated at 80 °C. Additional methyl acrylate (1.32 mL, 14.7
mmol) is added after 8 h and 12 h, respectively. After 17 h, volatiles
are removed at reduced pressure and the residue is dissolved in ethyl
acetate. The solution is washed with brine, dried (anhydrous sodium
sulfate), filtered and concentrated at reduced pressure to afford the
desired product. Oil, yield 2.13 g, 94 %. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 2.80
(t, 2 H), 3.71 (s, 3 H), 4.29 (t, 2 H), 6.94 (s, 1 H), 7.06 (s, 1 H),
7.52 (s, 1 14); MS (ESI+) for C7H10N2O2 m/z 155.2 (M+H)+.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM sealed pressure tube used, incremental addition of methyl acrylate
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of flavin derivatives to be used as riboswitch ligands or
anti-infective agents
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Experimental Procedure: A mixture of
4-bromotoluene (1 mmol), imidazole (1.2 mmol), K2CO3 (2 mmol) and
Cu(II)-NaY (100 mg) in DMF (3 mL) was heated to 120 °C for the specified
time (Table 2). The progress of the reaction was monitored by GC or TLC.
The reaction mixture was filtered to separate the catalyst and the
filtrate was quenched with aq NaHCO3 and the product extracted with
EtOAc. The combined organic layers were washed with brine, dried over
Na2SO4 and concentrated. The residue was purified by column
chromatography to afford pure 1-(4-methylphenyl)-1H-imidazole. Table 2
Entry 4, yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM Cu(II)-NaY zeolite catalyst used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM A mild and efficient method for N-arylation of nitrogen heterocycles with
aryl halides catalyzed by Cu(II)-NaY zeolite
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kantam, M. Lakshmi; Rao, B. Purna Chandra; Choudary, B. M.; Reddy, R.
Sudarshan
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synlett (2006), (14), 2195-2198

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for the N-arylation of
imidazole with iodobenzene catalyzed by homogeneous copper(II) Schiff
base catalyst In a 100 mL RB flask, homogeneous copper catalyst (0.0156
mmol), iodobenzene (1 mmol), imidazole (1.2 mmol), K2CO3 (2 mmol), and
DMSO (10 mL) were stirred under nitrogen atmosphere at 120 °C. After the
completion of the reaction, the filtrate was extracted with ethyl acetate
(3 x 20 mL) and the combined organic layers were dried with anhydrous
Na2SO4. The filtrate was concentrated by vacuum, then the reaction
mixture was identified by GC-MS and quantified by GC analysis. Table 5.
Entry 4. Yield 93%

complex prepared and used as catalyst, catalyst recyclable

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure B: Coupling of Aryl halides
with Amides, Imidazoles, Phenols or Thiols. (Table 2, entry 4): An
oven-dried Schlenk tube equipped with a Teflon valve was charged with a
magnetic stir bar, Cs2CO3 (684 mg, 2.1 mmol), CuBr (15 mg, 0.10 mmol, 10
mol%), and ethyl 2-oxocyclohexanecarboxylate (34 mg, 0.20 mmol, 20 mol%)
The tube was evacuated and backfilled with N2 (this procedure was
repeated three times). Under a counter flow of N2, DMSO (0.5 mL) was
added by syringe at room temperature (25-30 °C) and pre-stirred for 0.5
h. Then a solution of 1-iodo-4-methylbenzene (218 mg, 1.0 mmol),
2-pyrrolidinone (102 mg, 1.2 mmol) in DMSO (0.5 mL) was added via syringe
under a counter flow of N2. The tube was sealed and the mixture was
allowed to stir for 24 h at 60 ºC. The reaction mixture was directly
passed through celite. After rinsed with further 60 mL of ethyl acetate,
the combined filtrate was washed by saturated brine (10 ml × 2). After
the organic layer was dried by Na2SO4, it was concentrated by rotatory
evaporation. The residue was purified bycolumn chromatography on silica
gel using hexane/ethyl acetate (1:1) as eluent to give a white solid of
1-p-tolylpyrrolidin-2-one (151 mg, 86 %). 1d, 1-p-tolylpyrrolidin-2-one4
(Table 2, entry 4, 10) 2b, 1-(4-chlorophenyl)-1H-imidazole10 (Table 3,
entries 2 and 6) Procedure B was followed. Yellow solid; 1H NMR (400 MHz,
CDCl3) δ 7.82 (1 H, s), 7.43-7.46 (2H, m), 7.32-7.35 (2H, m), 7.25 (1H,
s), 7.21 (1 H, s); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 135.7, 135.4, 133.0, 130.6,
129.9, 122.6, 118.0 (CDCl3 δ 77.0).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM chemoselective

$DATUM A β-Keto Ester as a Novel, Efficient, and Versatile Ligand for
Copper(I)-Catalyzed C-N, C-O, and C-S Coupling Reactions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Lv, Xin; Bao, Weiliang

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for the N-arylation of
imidazoles with aryl iodides. An oven-dried screw-cap test tube was
charged with Cu2O (0.025 mmol), L1c (0.075 mmol), imidazole (1.2 mmol),
aryl iodide (1.00 mmol, if solid), poly(ethylene glycol) (200 mg), Cs2CO3
(1.4 mmol), and a magnetic stir bar. The reaction vessel was fitted with
a rubber septum. The vessel was evacuated and back-filled with argon or
nitrogen, and this sequence was repeated an additional time. Aryl iodide
(1.00 mmol, if liquid) and solvent (0.5 mL) were then added successively.
The reaction tube was sealed, and stirred in a pre-heated oil bath for
the designated time period. The reaction mixture was cooled to room
temperature, diluted with dichloromethane (10 mL), and filtered through a
plug of celite, eluting with additional dichloromethane (50 mL). The
filtrate was concentrated and the resulting residue was purified by flash
chromatography to provide the desired product. 1-Phenyl-1H-imidazole (1a)
1-Naphthalen-1-yl-1H-imidazole (1i) The general procedure was followed
using Cu2O (7.2 mg, 0.05 mmol), L1c (36 mg, 0.15 mmol), PEG (200 mg),
Cs2CO3 (0.45 g, 1.4 mmol), 1-iodonaphthalene (146 μL, 1.00 mmol), and
imidazole (82 mg, 1.2 mmol) with NMP (0.3 mL) as solvent for 24 h at 110
°C. The crude reaction mixture was dissolved in 20 mL of water, and
extracted with dichloromethane (5 x 30 mL). The combined organic layers
were dried with MgSO4, and the solvent was removed in vacuo.
Chromatographic purification (hexane / ethyl acetate 1 : 1) provided
1-naphthalen-1-yl-1H-imidazole (yellow-white solid, 179 mg, 92%). 1H NMR
(300 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.94-7.92 (m, 2H), 7.76, (bs, 1H), 7.61-7.48 (m, 4 H),
7.43 (d, 1H, J = 7.0 Hz), 7.30 (bs, 1H), 7.25 (bs, 1H). m.p. 63-64 °C
(Lit. 62 °C).12
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Copper-Catalyzed N-Arylation of Imidazoles and Benzimidazoles

$DATUM Altman, Ryan A.; Koval, Erica D.; Buchwald, Stephen L.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Catalytic
N-Arylation of Nitrogen- Containing Heterocycles with Aryl and Heteroaryl
Halides. A flamedried Schlenk test tube with a magnetic stirring bar was
charged with CuI (9.5 mg, 0.05 mmol), 4a-2 (145 mg, 0.1 mmol of the
L-proline unit), K2CO3 (165 mg, 1.2 mmol), nitrogen-containing
heterocycle (0.5 mmol), aryl or heteroaryl halide (0.6 mmol), and DMSO (2
mL) under N2. A rubber septum was replaced with a glass stopper, and the
system was then evacuated three times and backfilled with N2. The
reaction mixture was stirred for 30 min at room temperature and then
heated at 120 °C for 60 h. The resulting mixture was cooled to ambient
temperature, diluted with 2-3 mL of ethyl acetate, filtered through a
plug of silica gel, and washed with 10-20 mL of ethyl acetate. The
filtrate was concentrated, and the resulting residue was purified by
column chromatography on silica gel to provide the desired product.
4-Imidazol-1-yl-benzonitrile (6c)1 Following the general procedure,
imidazole (0.034 g, 0.5 mmol) was coupled with 4-bromobenzonitrile (0.108
g, 0.6 mmol) for 60 h at 90 ºC. The crude product was purified over a
silica gel column using ethyl acetate/petrol ether (1/1) to give a white
solid (95% yield). 1H NMR (600 MHz, CDCl3): δ 7.27 (s, 1H), 7.35 (s, 1H),
7.54 (d, J = 8.4 Hz, 2H), 7.81 (d, J = 8.4 Hz, 2H), 7.99 (s, 1H) ppm. 13C
NMR (150 MHz, CDCl3): δ 110.9, 117.5, 117.8, 121.3, 131.4, 134.1, 135.2,
140.4 ppm. GC-MS (EI, m/z): 169 [M+]
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

complex)

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Catalytic
N-Arylation of Nitrogen-Containing Heterocycles with Aryl Halides. A
flame-dried Schlenk test tube with a magnetic stirring bar was charged
with CuI (9.6 mg, 0.05 mmol), ligand (0.1 mmol), Cs2CO3 (0.652 g, 2.0
mmol), nitrogen-containing heterocycle (1.0 mmol), aryl or heteroaryl
halide (1.2 mmol), and DMF (2 mL) under N2. A rubber septum was replaced
with a glass stopper, and the system was then evacuated twice and back
filled with N2. The reaction mixture was stirred for 30 min at room
temperature, and then heated to 110 °C for 24 h. The reaction mixture was
then cooled to ambient temperature, diluted with 2-3 mL of ethyl acetate,
filtered through a plug of silica gel, and washed with 10-20 mL of ethyl
acetate. The filtrate was concentrated and the resulting residue was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel to provide the desired
product. 1-Phenyl-1H-imidazole (7a) 2 4-Imidazol-1-yl-benzonitrile (7d)2
Following the general procedure, imidazole (0.068 g, 1.0 mmol) was
coupled with 4-bromobenzonitrile (0.216 g, 1.2 mmol) in the presence of
ligand 4a. The crude product was purified over a silica gel column using
ethyl acetate/petrol ether (1/1) to give a white solid (95% yield). 1H
NMR (600 MHz, CDCl3): δ 7.27 (s, 1H), 7.35 (s, 1H), 7.54 (d, J = 8.4 Hz,
2H), 7.81 (d, J = 8.4 Hz, 2H), 7.99 (s, 1H) ppm. 13C NMR (150 MHz,
CDCl3): δ 110.9, 117.5, 117.8, 121.3, 131.4, 134.1, 135.2, 140.4 ppm.
GC-MS (EI, m/z): 169 [M+].
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Copper-Catalyzed
Coupling of Nitrogen Heterocycles and Aryl Bromides A flame-dried Schlenk
test tube with a magnetic stirring bar was charged with CuBr (14 mg, 0.1
mmol), ligand (30 mg, 0.2 mmol), Cs2CO3 (652 mg, 2.0 mmol), amine or
nitrogen-containing heterocycle (1.0 mmol), aryl halide (1.2 mmol) and
DMSO (1 mL) under N2. After the reaction mixture was heated at 80°C for
12 h or at 90°C for 24 h, the reaction mixture was cooled to ambient
temperature, diluted with 2-3 mL of ethyl acetate, filtered through a
plug of silica gel, and washed with 10 mL of ethyl acetate. The filtrate
was concentrated and the resulting residue was purified by column
chromatography on silica gel (ethyl acetate/petroleum ether) to provide
the desired product. 4-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)benzonitrile (2j) Following the
general procedure, imidazole (68 mg, 1.0 mmol) was coupled with
benzonitrile (217 mg, 1.2 mmol) at the indicated condition. The crude
product was purified over a silica gel column using ethyl acetate/petrol
ether (1/2-2:1, v/v) giving slight yellow solid, Yield 94% 1H NMR (400
MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.0-8.2 (br, 1H), 7.81 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 2H), 7.55 (d, J =
8.0 Hz, 2H), 7.48 (br, 1H), 7.28 (s, 1H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ
140.9, 134.3, 132.0, 127.6, 121.5, 118.0, 111.1; GC-MS (EI, m/z) 169
[M+].6

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Synthesis of 1,10-(1,4-butanediyl)-bis-imidazole (3). A mixture of
imidazole (2.72 g, 40 mmol) and sodium hydroxide (1.60 g, 40 mmol) in 10
mL of dimethylsulfoxide was stirred at 60 °C for 1 h. Then cooled to room
temperature and 1,4-dichlorobutane (2.54 g, 20 mmol) was added and
stirred at room temperature for 14 h. The resulting mixture was poured
into 200 mL of ice-cold water and the precipitated product was filtered,
washed with cold water (3 × 20 mL), and dried to give the product. Yield:
A white powder, 3.58 g, 94%. m.p. 88-9 °C. Found: C, 62.90; H, 7.58; N,
29.23%. Calc. for C10H14N4: C, 63.13; H, 7.42; N, 29.45%. 1H NMR (CDCl3)
d 1.72 (m, 4H), 3.90 (m, 4H), 6.83 (s, 2H), 7.02 (s, 2H), 7.40 (s, 2H).
13C NMR (CDCl3) d 28.1, 46.3, 118.6, 129.8, 136.9.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for the N-arylation of
imidazoles with aryl iodides. An oven-dried screw-cap test tube was
charged with Cu2O (0.025 mmol), L (0.075 mmol), imidazole (1.2 mmol),
aryl iodide (1.00 mmol, if solid), poly(ethylene glycol) (200 mg), Cs2CO3
(1.4 mmol), and a magnetic stir bar. The reaction vessel was fitted with
a rubber septum. The vessel was evacuated and back-filled with argon or
nitrogen, and this sequence was repeated an additional time. Aryl iodide
(1.00 mmol, if liquid) and solvent (0.5 mL) were then added successively.
The reaction tube was sealed, and stirred in a pre-heated oil bath for
the designated time period. The reaction mixture was cooled to room
temperature, diluted with dichloromethane (10 mL), and filtered through a
plug of celite, eluting with additional dichloromethane (50 mL). The
filtrate was concentrated and the resulting residue was purified by flash
chromatography to provide the desired product. Experimental procedures
for the N-arylation of imidazole with aryl iodides. 1-Phenyl-1H-imidazole
1-(3-Nitro-phenyl)-1H-imidazole The general procedure was followed using
Cu2O (3.6 mg, 0.025 mmol), L (18 mg, 0.075 mmol), PEG (200 mg), Cs2CO3
(0.45 g, 1.4 mmol), 3-nitroiodobenzene (249 mg, 1.00 mmol), and imidazole
(83 mg, 1.2 mmol) with acetonitrile (0.5 mL) as solvent for 29 h at 80
°C. Chromatographic purification (hexane / ethyl acetate 1 : 3)
1-(3-nitro-phenyl)-1H-imidazole (white solid, 177 mg, 93 %). 1H NMR (500
MHz, CDCl3) δ 8.25 (t, 1H, J = 1.9), 8.19 (ddd, 1H, J = 1.1, 1.9, 7.9
Hz), 7.94 (s, 1H), 7.75 (ddd, 1H, J = 1.4, 2.2, 8.1 Hz), 7.69 (t, 1H, J =
8.0 Hz), 7.36 (s, 1H), 7.23 (s, 1H). 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 149.1,
138.3, 125.5, 131.5, 131.2, 126.9, 122.1, 118.0, 116.2. m.p. 109-110 °C
(Lit. 109-110 °C).5 A copy of the 1H NMR spectrum is provided.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM 4,7-Dimethoxy-1,10-phenanthroline: An excellent ligand for the
Cu-catalyzed N-arylation of imidazoles
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Altman, Ryan A.; Buchwald, Stephen L.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organic Letters (2006), 8(13), 2779-2782

$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure. An oven-dried 25 mL
round-bottomed flask with a magnetic stirring bar was charged with CuI
nanoparticles (1.25 mol %), K2CO3 (0.1662 g, 1.2 mmol),
nitrogencontaining heterocycle (1.2 mmol)/phenol (1.2 mmol), aryl
chloride (1.0 mmol), and DMF (1 mL) under air. The reaction mixture was
stirred for 30 min at room temperature and then transferred to a
preheated oil bath at 110 °C. At the end of the reaction, as judged by
TLC, the reaction mixture was then cooled to room temperature, diluted
with 2-3 mL of EtOAc, and centrifuged to remove the catalyst, and the
catalyst was further washed with 5-10 mL of EtOAc to make it free from
organic matter. The combined organic extracts were then concentrated
under reduced pressure, and the resulting residue was purified by column
chromatography on silica gel (60-120) using hexane/ethyl acetate (80:20)
eluent to provide the desired N-arylated/ O-arylated product. The
catalyst was oven-dried at 65 °C for 2 h and reused.
1-(4-(trifluoromethyl)phenyl)-1H-imidazole (Table 2, Entry 12): Yield 95
%. 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3, ppm): δ 7.00-7.50 (m, 4H), 7.55-7.67 (m, 2H),
7.92 (br s, 1H); 13C NMR (75 MHz, CDCl3, ppm): δ 121.2, 122.2, 124.9,
127.2, 127.6, 129.3, 129.6. GCMS: m/z = 212 (M+).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM CuI nanoparticles used as cat..
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM CuI Nanoparticles for C-N and C-O Cross Coupling of Heterocyclic Amines
and Phenols with Chlorobenzenes
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Sreedhar, B.; Arundhathi, R.; Reddy, P. Linga; Kantam, M. Lakshmi
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(20), 7951-7954

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 1-Acetylimidazole: General procedure for the preparation of
acyl-imidazoles and -pyrazoles: In a typical experiment imidazole (20
mmol) was dissolved in distilled CH2Cl2 (20 mL) containing TEA (20 mmol)
and cooled to 0 degC under a steady flow of argon. The requisite acid
chloride (20 mmol) dissolved in 10 mL of CH2Cl2 (distilled) was delivered
dropwise over several minutes to the stirring solution imidazole solution
at 0 degC. The mixture was allowed to warm to 25 degC and stirred at this
temperature for 2 hr to ensure completion. The reaction mixture was then
diluted with 100 mL of diethyl ether, filtered and evaporated under
reduced pressure. Purification through silica gel with hexanes:ethyl
acetate (3:1) furnished 100 % yields. According to the general procedure,
the product was obtained. 2.0 g (93 %); white solid; mp 99-103 degC.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for Catalytic Reactions. A
solution of ligand (14.6 mg, 0.03 mmol), [(η 3-allyl)PdCl]2 (5.5 mg,
0.015 mmol), cinnamyl alcohol (1.0 mmol), and amine (1.5 mmol) in dioxane
(0.2 mL) was stirred under argon atmosphere at 80 °C for 2.5-8.0 h
(depending on substrate). The reaction mixture was then cooled to rt,
diluted with DCM (5 mL), and filtered through a pad of Na2SO4. The
filtrate was evaporated under reduced pressure, and the residue was
purified by flash column chromatography on silica gel (230-400 mesh)
using ethyl acetate/petroleum ether or methanol/dichloromethane as a
eluent. N-Cinnamylimidazole (5a)15. Solid. 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3): δ
7.55 (s, 1H), 7.38-7.26 (m, 5H), 7.10 (s, 1H), 6.96 (s, 1H), 6.52 (d, J =
15.8 Hz, 1H), 6.27 (td, J = 15.8, 6.1 Hz, 1H), 4.70 (d, J = 6.1 Hz, 2H).
13C NMR (75 MHz, CDCl3): δ 137.2, 135.8, 133.8, 129.7, 128.8, 128.4,
126.7, 123.8, 119.1, 49.1. Mp. 48.0 °C.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM Ghosh, Raju; Sarkar, Amitabha
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Arylazoles 3 and 4; General Procedure A sealed
tube equipped with a Teflon valve was charged with a magnetic stir bar,
CuBr (7 mg, 0.05 mmol, 5 mol%), Cs2CO3 (650 mg, 2 mmol) and any remaining
solids (azoles 2 and/or aryl halides 1). The tube was evacuated and
backfilled with N2 (3×). Under a counter flow of N2, azole 2 (1.2 mmol,
if liquid), aryl halide 1 (1 mmol, if liquid), DMSO (1.0 mL), and L1 (18
mg, 0.10 mmol, 10 mol%) were added by syringe. The tube was evacuated and
again backfilled with N2 (3×) and sealed. The mixture was heated to the
indicated temperature for the required time period. After cooling to
r.t., the mixture was diluted with EtOAc (25 mL), passed through a
fritted glass filter to remove the inorganic salts and the filtrate was
washed by H2O, brine, then removed under vacuum. The residue was purified
by column chromatography (silica gel) and the product was dried under
high vacuum (at least 1 h).
1-[4-Chloro-3-(trifluoromethyl)phenyl]-1H-imidazole (3j) 1H NMR (300 MHz,
DMSO-d 6): δ = 8.42 (s, 1 H), 8.12 (d, 1 H), 8.02 (m, 1 H), 7.90 (m, 2
H), 7.15 (s, 1 H). 13C NMR (75 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 136.0, 135.5, 133.1,
131.4, 131.2, 130.4, 127.5, 125.4, 123.9, 120.75, 120.67, 120.61, 120.54,
120.29, 118.1. MS: m/z = 246. HRMS (EI): m/z [M]+ calcd for C10H7ClF3N2:
247.0244; found: 247.0240.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: An oven-dried 100 mL round-bottomed flask with
a magnetic stirring bar was charged with CuI (1 mol, 19 mg), K2CO3 (12
mmol, 1.66 g), substituted 1H-imidazole or 1H-benzo[d]imidazole (12
mmol), substituted 1-fluoro-2-nitrobenzene (10 mmol), and DMF (10 mL)
under nitrogen. The mixture was stirred for 24 h at 110 °C. The resulting
solution was then cooled to room temperature and filtered. The solid was
washed with ethyl acetate for three times (3 x 10 mL), and the combined
filtrate was concentrated by the rotary evaporator, and the residue was
purified by column chromatography on silica gel using petroleum
ether/ethyl acetate (1:1) as eluent to give I. Yield 95%.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 1-(3-Fluorobenzyl)-1H-imidazole (19E) Imidazole (4.4 mmol, 300 mg) and
sodium hydride (8.8 mmol, 211 mg) were dissolved in abs. THF (15ml).
3-Fluorobenzyl bromide (4.4 mmol, 540 μl) was slowly added and the
mixture was stirred for 16 h. The reaction was quenched by slow addition
of isopropyl alcohol and water and the aqueous phase was extracted with
Et2O (3 x 50 ml). The combined organic layers were washed with brine,
dried over sodium sulfate and the solvent was removed completely under
reduced pressure to yield a light brownish oil which was used without
further purification. Yield: 735 mg (95 %). C10H9FN2, M = 176.2 g/mol.
Purity: 97 % (HPLC-ESI-MS, 214 nm), [M+ H]+ = 177.2 m/z.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Ethyl 2-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)-2-oxoacetate (2)1 A solution of ethyl
chlorooxoacetate (4.9 mL, 44 mmol, 1.0 equiv) in THF (20 mL) was added
dropwise to a solution containing imidazole (5.96 g, 88 mmol, 2.0 equiv)
in THF (80 ml) at 0°C under argon. After 3 h at 0°C, the solution was
filtered and the solid was washed with dry THF (20 mL). The filtrate was
evaporated in vacuo and the crude product was distilled under reduced
pression (bp = 100°C, 0.1 mbar) to give 2 as a yellow oil (7.02 g, 41.7
mmol, 95%). Ethyl 2-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)-2-oxoacetate (2), yield (7.02 g,
41.7 mmol, 95%) IR (neat): 3157, 2985, 1727, 1468, 1261, 1211, 1094,
1071, 1004, 945, 749, 641 cm-1. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 8.51 (s, 1H),
7.68 (s, 1H), 7.15 (s, 1H), 4.51 (q, J = 7.1 Hz, 2H), 1.46 (t, J = 7.1
Hz, 3H). 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3): δ 158.1 (s), 154.6 (s), 138.1 (d),
131.4 (d), 117.0 (d), 64.3 (t), 13.9 (q).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM Organic Letters (2010), 12(16), 3693-3695
